div.p: A PLAINE AND EASIE CATECHISME: Wherein the Grounds and Principles of Chriſtian Religion are briefly taught; And likewiſe proved by SCRIPTURE.
Publiſhed for the benefit of all, By R: A.
LONDON, Printed for William Franckling, and are to be ſold at his Shop near the Signe of the George in Norwich. 1649.

div.head: A Plaine and eaſie CATECHISME.

p.label: Qu
p.hi: WHat Religion doſt thou profeſſe?

div.p: An. The Chriſtian Religion.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the Chriſtian RELIGION?

div.p: A. The worſhipping the true God as preſcribed, Mat. 4.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How know you this the true Religion?

div.p: A. Firſt, this Religion forbids all evill, and commands all good, Iſa. 1.16, 17.
Secondly, this commands the heart as life, Deut. 26.16.
Thirdly, it is a ſpirituall reall worſhip, Iohn. 4.24.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How come you to underſtand this Religion?

div.p: A. By catechizing: by preaching.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is catechizing?

div.p:
A. A plain familiar teaching of the principles of Religion: by which I am made able
to anſwer thereto, queſtioned therein, Heb. 6.1, 2. 1 Pet. 3.15.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doe you underſtand by preaching?

div.p: A. A ſound opening of Scripture by Scripture, with a ſuitable application to the benefit of the hearer, Luk. 4.18, 19.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Who are to catechize?

div.p: A. Paſtors in their flocks, Ioh. 21.15. Parents in their families, Eph. 6.4.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Who are to be catechized?

div.p: A. Children in yeares, Pro. 22.6. Children in underſtanding, Rom. 2.18.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In what conſiſt the principles of Religion?

div.p: A. Firſt in the right knowledge of god.
Secondly in the right knowledge of man.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In what conſiſts the right knowledge of God?

div.p: A. In a true underſtanding of him as he is revealed in his will, Ioh. 5.39.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In what conſiſts a right knowledge of man?

div.p: A. In a clear underſtanding of his condition as it was, is, ſhalbe.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How is the knowledge of God revealed in his word?

div.p: A. Firſt in his being.
Secondly in his working.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How is God in his being made manifeſt?

div.p: Firſt, in regard of his nature, or eſſentially.
Secondly, in reſpect of his ſubſiſtence, or perſonally.
Thirdly, in reference to his Attributes, or nominally.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How is God in his working made knowne in his word?

div.p: A. Firſt, in reſpect of his creating all in time.
Secondly, in reſpect of his preſerving all till time be.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How is God in his nature revealed?

div.p: A. An everlaſting being in himſelfe from himſelfe, Pſal. 90.1, 2. Exo. 3.14.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How is God revealed in his Subſiſtence?

div.p: A. Three perſons in one divine nature.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is a perſon in the divine nature?

div.p: A. A divers manner of Subſiſting, diſtinguiſhed each from other by an incommunicable propriety, as the Father to beget the Son, and only to beget: the Son and onely the Son to be begotten: the Holy Ghoſt and onely the Holy Ghoſt to proceed.

p.label: Q
p.hi: Is each of theſe perſons God?

div.p: A. Yes, The Father is God, Eph. 6.23.
The Son is God, 1 Ioh. 5.20.
The Holy Ghoſt is God, Acts. 5.3.4.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Are there not more Gods then one then?

div.p: A. No: for theſe three are but one, 1 Ioh. 5.7.

p.label: Q.
p.hi:
What doth your Religion teach you to beleeve
concerning theſe three Perſons?

div.p: A. Concerning the Father, that he is the Creator and preſerver of all things in earth and heaven, Pſal. 33.6.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Did not the Son and Holy Ghoſt create alſo?

div.p: A. Yes equally; but appropriated to the Father, as the Fountaine from whence all, as to diſtinguiſh the Son and Holy Ghoſt, Col. 1.15, 16, 17. Gen. 1.2.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Creation?

div.p: A. A production of all things out of nothing, but by the omnipotent word of God, Heb. 11.3.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What be theſe all things?

div.p: A. Sun, Moon, Starrs, Angels, Man, with birds flying, fiſh ſwimming, beaſts feeding, &c. Pſal. 148.5.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: To what end were all created?

div.p: A. Firſt, for the manifeſtation of his glory, Prov. 16.4.
Secondly, for the plentifull comfort of man, Rom 1.19, 20.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the preſerving that belongs to the Father?

div.p: A. That mercifull goodneſſe by which the creature is preſerved and governed, Pſal. 36.6. Pſa. 67.4.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How doth it appeare God is the Preſerver?

div.p: A. By the Scriptures in Pſal. 135.5, 6, 7. Acts 17.25, 28.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doſt beleeve concerning the Son?

div.p: A. That he is equal with the Father, Phil. 2.7. from all eternity deputed, King over, Prieſt for, Prophet to his Church, Pſal. 2.6, Pſal. 10.4. Deut. 18.18. Acts 3.23.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What elſe beleeve you concerning Chriſt?

div.p: A. That in due time he was borne, Gal. 4.4. lived, dyed, roſe againe, ſits at Gods right hand till he come to judge the quick and dead, Rom. 5.4, 25. Eph. 1.20. Acts 3.21.
Qu. What beleeveſt thou concerning the Holy Ghoſt?

A. That he is God equall with the Father and Son, from whence we receive enlightning, ſtrengthning, ſanctification, comfort and power to mortifie ſinne, quicken grace, 1 John 5.7. Joh. 16.13. Acts 1.8. Rom. 15.16. Joh. 14.16. Rom. 8.13.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How is God revealed by his Attributes?

div.p: A. That he is a perfect, wiſe, powerfull, mercifull, faithfull, eternall, and moſt holy God, &c.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doſt underſtand by a perfect God?

div.p: A. I underſtand that God is abſolutely perfect in himſelfe, and the cauſe of perfection in others, Gen. 17.1. 1 John 1.5.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What underſtandeſt thou by this, God is a wiſe God?

div.p:
A. That God is ſo infinite in his underſtanding, that he only knowes himſelfe, all things that have been, are, ſhall, and never ſhall be,
with every Circumſtance, Pſal. 147.5. 1 Cor. 2.13. Heb. 4.13. Pſal. 147.4. Rom. 4.17.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What underſtandeſt thou by Powerfull?

div.p: A. That God is able to act what he will, and afford ſtrength to the creature to doe what he liſt, Iſa. 46.10. Pſal. 68.35. Deu. 33.27.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What understandeſt thou by Merciful?

div.p: A. That God is ready to help Such as are or may be in miſery, Dan. 9.9. Pſal. 145.14. Pſa. 103.4.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What underſtandeſt thou by this Attribute Faithfull?

div.p: A. That God is one, ever true and faithfull of his word, Deu. 7.9. 2 Cor. 1.20. Pſa 89. from 1 to 9.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What underſtandeſt thou by this Attribute Eternall?

div.p: A. That God hath a being without begining and end, Pſal. 90.1. 2. Deut. 24.27.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What underſtandeſt thou by Holy?

div.p: A. That God is infinitely pure and righteous in himſelfe, and the author of all holyneſſe in the creature, Iſa. 6.3. Ezek 37.28. Iſa. 63.18.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth your Religion teach you concerning the right underſtanding of man?

div.p:
A. It teacheth me concerning his eſtate of
Creation.
Corruption.
Grace.
Glory.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are you taught concerning mans Creation?

div.p: A. That he was made of the duſt of the earth in regard of his body, and of the breath of God in regard of his ſoule, Gen. 2.7.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In what eſtate was he created?

div.p: A. In a good, wiſe, holy condition, after the image of God himſelfe, Gen. 1.27. Eccl. 7.29. Ephe. 4.23, 24.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Doth not man keep that condition ſtill?

div.p: A. No: he fell by diſobeying the command in eating the forbidden fruit, Gen. 2.17.3.6.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What did man loſe by this fall?

div.p: A. Firſt the favour of God which he enjoyed, Gen. 38.9.
Secondly, the image of God which he poſeſſed. Pſa. 51.6.
Q. Was this all he Suffered?
A. No: Firſt he and his become mortall, Gen. 2.17.3.22.
Secondly, his poſterity ſinfull, Rom. 5.12.
Thirdly, ſubject to wrath and judgment, Rom. 5.16.
Fourthly the Creature curſed, Gen. 3.17.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How ſhould wee ſin or ſuffer, when we were not?

div.p: A. Adam was a publick perſon, and we in his loynes, ſo wee ſin and ſuffer, Rom. 5.12. 1 Cor. 15.12.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Cannot man recover himſelfe from this condition?

div.p:
A. No: being in ſin born, and unable to
thinke one good thought, or ſatisfie divine juſtice, Pſal. 5.5. 2 Cor. 3.5.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How ſhall poore man eſcape the miſery he is brought into by Adams fall?

div.p: A. By Jeſus Chriſt the promiſed ſeed, Gen. 3.15. Gal. 3.16.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Jeſus Chriſt?

div.p: A. Perfect God, and perfect man; who in time came and laid downe his life for his, Gal. 4.4, 5. Rom. 5.19.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: VVhy was Chriſt God?

div.p: A. To ſatisfie divine juſtice, Pſal. 40.6, 7.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Why was he man?

div.p: A. For he was to ſuffer, Heb. 2.14.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Why God and man?

div.p: A. To reconcile God to man, 2. Cor. 5.19.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Where is Chriſt?

div.p: A. At the right hand of God, Col. 3.1.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How ſhall we partake of Chriſts benefits?

div.p: A. By faith in Jeſus Chriſt, Ephe. 3.17.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is faith in Jeſus Chriſt?

div.p: A. A particular receiving & applying Chriſt to my ſoul as he is revealed in the word, 1 Ioh. 12.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What benefit will Chriſt procure by faith applyed?

div.p: A. Firſt, A regaining of Gods favour, Eph. 2.5, 6.
Secondly, A renewing of Gods jmage, 1 Cor. 1.30. Eph. 4.26.
Thirdly, with aſſurance of eternall glory, Rom. 8.17.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What danger eſcape we by applying Chriſt?

div.p: A. Firſt, the ſting of death, 1 Cor. 15.55.
Secondly, The ſlavery of ſin, Rom. 7.25.
Thirdly, The wrath of God, Rom. 5.9.
Fourthly, The curſe of creatures, Col. 1.15.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In what conſiſts the eſtate of Glory?

div.p:
A. Firſt, in the freedome from all
ſin, Rev. 22.3, 15.
miſery, Rev. 21.4.
Secondly, in the enjoyment of all good, Rev. 21.23, 25.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth Chriſt expect from man for theſe his unſpeakable mercies?

div.p:
A. Chriſtian obſervance to his
Commands enjoyned.
Prayer preſcribed.
Sacraments appointed.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Which be the Commandements enjoyned?

div.p: A. Thoſe written in 20 of Exodus, 3, &c.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the firſt Commandement?

div.p: A. Thou ſhalt have no other God before me.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning hereof?

div.p: A. That tis my duty to love, feare and truſt in God alone.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the ſecond?

div.p: A. That no Idolatry, nor Idolatrous worſhip, be committed by me; but outwardly and inwardly God is to be ſerved as he will of me.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the third Commandement?

div.p: A. That I nor blaſpheme, curſe, ſweare, or lightly uſe the name of God.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the fourth Commandement?

div.p: A. That I prepare to ſanctifie God in, and meditate on the duties of a ſabbath day.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the fifth Commandement?

div.p: A. That I reverence, obey, love my parents, that is Magiſtrates, Miniſters, Governours, and all my Superiours.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the ſixth Commandement?

div.p: A. That nor in tongue, deſire, action, or approbation, I harm my ſelfe or other.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the Seventh Commandement?

div.p: A. That I ſhun all occaſions, contemplations, actions, ſpeeches, tending to Adultery, Fornication, or any uncleanneſſe whatſoever.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the eighth Commandement?

div.p: A. That I nor violently nor frandulently, rob, oppreſſe, deceive mine or my neighbour.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the ninth Commandement?

div.p: A. That I nor accuſe, backbite, lye, flatter, willingly or unjuſtly.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the tenth Comdement?

div.p: A. That I labour for purity of heart, and cleanneſſe of thought in all my converſation.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Prayer?

div.p: A. A powring out of the ſoule to God, believing we ſhall be heard for Chriſts ſake, Pſal. 62.8. Heb. 11.6. Joh. 16.23.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is that prayer preſcribed for us by Chriſt?

div.p: A. That call'd the Lords Prayer, Mat. 6.9.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Of what parts doth this prayer conſiſt?

div.p:
It conſiſts of
1 Preface.
2 Petition.
3 Concluſion.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the preface?

div.p: A. Our father which art in heaven.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the Petition.

div.p: A. Hallowed be thy name, &c.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the concluſion?

div.p: A. Thine is the Kingdome, &c.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the firſt Petition?

div.p: That God in himſelfe, words, workes, be honoured by us, and the contrary rooted out of us.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the ſecond petition?

div.p: A. That by the power of Gods word and Spirit there may be dayly added ſuch as ſhalbe ſaved, being delivered from the power of darkneſſe and tranſlated, 1. Col. 13.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the third Petition?

div.p: A. That God would frame our will in all things to obey him as the angels in heaven.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the 〈…〉

div.p: A. That God would ſend ſuch things and perſons as are convenient for us and neceſſary to us in this life.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the fifth Petition?

div.p: A. That our ſins paſt be pardoned to us, and for the time to come ſubdued in us, expreſſed by a full forgiveneſſe of all our treſpaſſours againſt us.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the meaning of the ſixth Petition?

div.p: A. That nor by world, fleſh, Satan, we be carried into ſin, miſery, temptation, damnation.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the Sacraments Chriſt hath ordained?

div.p: A. Baptiſme and the Lords Supper?

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is a Sacrament?

div.p: A. An outward ſacred ſigne of an inward ſealed grace?

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Baptiſme?

div.p: A. A Sacrament of our admitting into the Church, and of our engrafting into Chriſt.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the ſacred ſigne?

div.p: A. Water by word and prayer ſanctified; with which the perſon is dipped and ſprinkled.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the ſealed grace?

div.p: A. Remiſſion and Sanctification.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is required of ſuch as are baptiſed?

div.p: A. Repentance to confeſſe ſin, faith to beleeve grace ſealed.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Why ſhould children be baptiſed?

div.p: A. F •• ſt, they are in the covenant, Gen. 17.7.
Secondly, the promiſe to them, Acts. 2.39.
Thirdly to them the Holy Ghoſt, Luk. 1.15.
Fourthly, the Command is vniverſall, Mat. 28.19.
Fifthly, the practiſe of antiquity.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the Lords Supper?

div.p: A. A Sacrament confirming and ſealing the graces of Chriſt to the ſoule of every worthy Receiver.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the outward ſacred ſigne?

div.p: A. Bread and Wine.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the inward ſealed grace?

div.p:
An. The Body & Bloud of Jeſus Chriſt, with all his
Promiſes.
Graces.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Why was it inſtituted?

div.p: A. For a Remembrance of Chriſt in our hearts.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is required of thoſe that partake of this Sacrament of the Lords Supper?

div.p: A. Firſt, knowledge to diſcerne the Lords body, 1. Cor. 11.27, 29.
Secondly, faith to beleeve the myſtery of the Sacrament.
Thirdly, ſelfe examination, 1 Cor. 11.28.
Fourthly, thankfulneſſe for this ſtrengthening Sacrament.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: VVhat if man hath not theſe graces? what ſhould he doe?

div.p:
A. Let him mourn, pray, endeavour after them, that he be not guilty of Chriſts condemning
and crucifying

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How ſhall I obtaine theſe gifts and graces?

div.p: A. From the fountaine of all good, God the Father, by the merit of God the Son, through the influence of God the holy Ghoſt; three in one, one in three, to whom bee glory, praiſe, and power, now and ever. Amen.
